alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 13 at 11:29PM PST until December 14 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm to Produce Very Heavy Snow with Strong Winds and Whiteout Conditions... .A strong winter storm continues to bring very heavy snow to the mountains of northern California. Moderate to heavy snow showers will continue into Tuesday. Snow levels will gradually lower over time through late tonight and Tuesday and into the Sierra Foothills. Expect tremendous snow accumulation at pass levels with yardsticks required for snow measurement. This will result in significant travel delays with extremely difficult to impossible travel over the mountains. Strong winds will further reduce visibilities during this event with whiteout conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT Until 10 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible through Tuesday. Damage to trees and power lines possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 4 feet are expected, with localized amounts exceeding 5 feet at higher elevations. d. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada. * WHEN...Until 10 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. Snow level rising to 3500 feet during the day on Tuesday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
